subject: Medicine
title: Topical and Transdermal Drugs
description: One-minute skill: Topical and Transdermal Drugs.

hook.text: A nicotine patch delivers a steady dose through your skin for 24 hours. No pills, no injections, no peaks.

buildup.text: Topical drugs act locallyâ€”creams, ointments, eye drops. Transdermal patches deliver drugs systemically through skin.

discovery.text: The skin is a barrier, so transdermal delivery works best with small, fat-soluble molecules.

twist.text: Fentanyl patches are so potent that a used patch discarded carelessly has killed children and pets.

climax.text: Transdermal delivery avoids the first-pass effect and provides consistent drug levelsâ€”ideal for chronic conditions.

punchline.text: Slow and steady delivery through the skin wins for some drugs.

quiz.question: What advantage does transdermal delivery have over oral drugs?
options: It avoids the first-pass effect and provides steady drug levels
It works faster than intravenous injection
It can deliver any size molecule through the skin
